rev5.name: Provenance
rev5.changes_from_rev4: New control family introduced in Rev 5

attack_techniques.name: Exfiltration Over C2 Channel
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Provenance tracking that validates data origin and lineage at system boundaries enables detection of exfiltration over C2 channels by identifying data being transmitted that does not match authorized data flow origins.

attack_techniques.name: Exfiltration Over Alternative Protocol
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Supply chain provenance controls that track data lineage and validate authorized data transfer pathways enable detection of exfiltration over alternative protocols by flagging data leaving through uncharacterized channels.

attack_techniques.name: Exfiltration Over Physical Medium
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Provenance tracking for data movement to physical media—including chain-of-custody documentation and data classification enforcement—limits exfiltration by ensuring physical media transfers are authorized and traceable.

attack_techniques.name: Supply Chain Compromise
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Provenance verification of software components—including vendor validation, SBOM analysis, and supply chain attestation—directly detects supply chain compromise by identifying components with unverified or suspicious origins.

attack_techniques.name: Server Software Component
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Provenance validation of server software components—verifying publisher identity, code signing, and distribution chain integrity—detects unauthorized server components that adversaries install for persistent backdoor access.

attack_techniques.name: Compromise Host Software Binary
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Software binary provenance checking through hash verification, code signing validation, and integrity attestation detects compromise of host software binaries by identifying executables that deviate from their verified origin.

attack_techniques.name: Exfiltration Over Web Service
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Provenance controls that track data classification and authorized export channels enable detection of exfiltration over web services by identifying sensitive data being uploaded to unauthorized cloud destinations.

attack_techniques.name: Modify System Image
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Firmware provenance verification—including manufacturer attestation, signed image validation, and supply chain documentation—detects unauthorized system image modifications by comparing deployed firmware against verified baselines.

attack_techniques.name: Exfiltration Over Asymmetric Encrypted Non-C2 Protocol
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Provenance tracking identifying unauthorized encrypted data transfers to external destinations enables detection of exfiltration over asymmetric encrypted non-C2 protocols by flagging data leaving through uncharacterized paths.

attack_techniques.name: Exfiltration Over Unencrypted Non-C2 Protocol
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Data provenance controls that validate authorized cleartext data transfers enable detection of exfiltration over unencrypted protocols by identifying sensitive data flowing through channels without proper authorization.

attack_techniques.name: Exfiltration over USB
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Provenance tracking for USB data transfers—including device inventory, data classification enforcement, and transfer logging—enables detection of USB exfiltration by identifying unauthorized data movement to removable devices.

attack_techniques.name: AppleScript
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Provenance validation of AppleScript sources and automation workflows detects adversary execution by identifying scripts that did not originate from approved development pipelines or authorized automation frameworks.

attack_techniques.name: Compromise Software Dependencies and Development Tools
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Provenance verification of software dependencies—including package source validation, dependency pinning, and SBOM attestation—directly detects compromised development tools and poisoned library dependencies.

attack_techniques.name: Compromise Software Supply Chain
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Supply chain provenance controls that verify software distribution integrity—including build reproducibility, signed releases, and distribution chain validation—detect software supply chain compromise at the delivery stage.

attack_techniques.name: Compromise Hardware Supply Chain
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Hardware provenance tracking—including manufacturer verification, tamper-evident packaging, and component attestation—detects hardware supply chain compromise by validating the origin and integrity of physical components.

attack_techniques.name: Malicious Image
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Container image provenance validation—including registry source verification, image signing, and build attestation—prevents execution of malicious container images by ensuring only images with verified origins are deployed.

attack_techniques.name: SQL Stored Procedures
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Provenance verification of SQL stored procedures—including code review attestation and deployment pipeline validation—detects adversary-implanted procedures by identifying database code with unverified origins.

attack_techniques.name: Transport Agent
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Provenance validation of Exchange transport agents through publisher verification and code signing detects adversary-installed agents by identifying transport components that did not originate from approved sources.

attack_techniques.name: IIS Components
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Provenance verification of IIS components—including module signing validation and deployment pipeline attestation—detects adversary-installed web server components by identifying modules with unverified origins.

attack_techniques.name: LC_LOAD_DYLIB Addition
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Provenance validation of Mach-O binaries for unauthorized LC_LOAD_DYLIB additions detects adversary persistence by identifying dynamic library loading directives that were not present in the original verified binary.

attack_techniques.name: Patch System Image
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Firmware provenance verification through manufacturer attestation and signed image validation detects adversary-patched system images by comparing deployed firmware hashes against vendor-certified baselines.

attack_techniques.name: Downgrade System Image
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Provenance tracking of firmware version history and manufacturer release records detects system image downgrades by identifying when deployed firmware versions do not match the currently approved release.
